newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - June 4.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - June 4.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Wednesday:

* U.S. stocks ended mixed on Tuesday, as falling bond interest rates lifted blue-chip shares, but a series of profit warnings sparked a sell-off in technology shares. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 22.75 points to 7,312.15.

* The government will announce the consumer price index for May and trade figures after its monthly cabinet meeting. Reuters reported on Monday that the May consumer price index was seen rising 0.18-0.20 percent month/month vs 0.56 percent in April.

* Indonesia will run an unprecedented revote on the East Java island of Madura on Wednesday. Electoral officers said there would be a revote at 86 polling stations in Sampang town after an angry crowd alleging election rigging burned ballot boxes after last Thursday's polls.
MARKET
* On Tuesday, Jakarta stocks ended down due to profit taking after recent sharp gains, brokers said. The Jakarta index fell 1.33 points, or 0.19 percent, to close at 698.40 points.
* On Wednesday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,426.00/60.50 at 0140 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,427.00/28.00.
STOCKS TO WATCH

* Industry and Trade Minister Tungky Ariwibowo reportedly said civil servants and state-owned companies should buy the Timor national car, produced by PT Timor Putra Nasional in cooperation with Kia Motors of South Korea. The move might dampen sentiment on car-makers Astra International and Bimantara.
* Conglomerate Bimantara might also draw attention following news reports on Tuesday that it had reduced the sale price of its cars by raising local content.
* Blue chip automaker Astra International on its planned stock split which is subject to shareholders' approval in their meeting on June 11.
* Bakrie & Brothers following reports that its unit, PT Bakrie Motor will start to produce vans by December 1997.
* Distribution and trading company Wicaksana Overseas International on its plan to issue bonus shares subject to shareholders' approval on June 26.

* Shipping and sea transportation company PT Berlian Laju Tanker on a report in Bisnis Indonesia daily in which the company indicated a first quarter net profit of five billion rupiah, or 20 percent higher from the same period last year.

* Adhesive producer Kurnia Kapuas Utama on market talk of a possible alliance with a foreign company coupled with a company statement that the firm was planning to expand its business into the chemical industry.
* PT Semen Cibinong on a newspaper report that it had indicated a first quarter net profit fall of 19 percent compared with the same 1996 period.
* Property firm Lippo Land on reports that the firm will buy a 15 percent stake in its sister company Lippo Karawaci from the market.
* Toll road operator Citra Marga said on Monday it will hold a shareholders' meeting on June 17 to discuss its proposed rights issue.
* Timber firm Barito Pacific after it announced a higher first quarter net profit of 31.0 billion rupiah, compared to 25.8 billion rupiah in the same year-ago period.
-- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
